Investors looking for stocks in the Broadcast Radio and Television sector might want to consider either Fox Corporation (FOX) or Netflix (NFLX) The best way to find great value stocks is to pair a strong Zacks Rank with an impressive grade in the Value category of our Style Scores system .  Our Value category highlights undervalued companies by looking at a variety of key metrics . FOX currently has a forward P/E ratio of 10.98 and NFLX has a PEG ratio of 49.03 . FOX also has a notable P/B ratio of 1.93 . NFLX holds a Value grade of A based on these metrics .  Both FOX and NFLX are impressive stocks with solid earnings outlooks . But based on these valuation figures, we feel that FOX is the superior value option right now .

Music streamer Spotify has crushed the S&P 500 and Nasdaq Composite so far this year . Streaming stocks have held up well in a turbulent market given they are not directly exposed to tariffs .  Shares of Netflix have gained 40% so far this year . That crushes the breakeven returns of theS&P 500andNasdaq Composite . With shares up nearly 60% year to date, Spotify Technology might be a company to put on your radar .  Unlike many companies in the technology landscape, streaming businesses don't have much to worry about when it comes to tariffs . For the most part, streamers rely on the consumption of digital content such as movies, television, music, or audiobooks . The chart below illustrates Spotify's stock price since its IPO .  Spotify has never split its stock, combined with its climbing share price, I see the company as an interesting stock-split candidate . Stock splits are a simple form of financial engineering . When share prices go higher investors often often look for alternatives .  Spotify trades at a notable premium compared to other streaming and entertainment companies on a forward earnings basis . In my view, Spotify is a pricey stock right now and the momentum in share price has led to some notable valuation expansion .  Spotify is a best-in-class opportunity in the streaming landscape and a stock deserving of a premium . I would not chase at these levels -- as I'd view the stock as overvalued . However, given how sensitive the capital markets are right now on the tariff rhetoric, I'd consider scooping up shares on any dips that might occur .
